class py_sim.plotting.plotting.DataPlot(*args, **kwargs)¶

Class that defines plotting framework for using the full Data

plot(data: Data[StateType]) → None¶

dict[int, int]

get_plan(end_index: int | None = None) → list[int]¶

Returns the plan. If the end index is left unspecified, then it is the plan to the goal

class py_sim.plotting.plotting.UnicycleTimeSeriesPlot(color: tuple[float, float, float, float], style: str = '-', fig: Figure | None = None, axs: list[matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes] | None = None, label: str = '')¶

Bases: Generic[UnicycleStateType]

Plots the unicycle state vs time with each state in its own subplot

fig(Figure): Figure on which the trajectories are plot axs(npt.NDArray(Axes)): The subplot axes on which everything is plot handle_x(Line2D): reference to the line on which the x state is plot handle_y(Line2D): reference to the line on which the y state is plot handle_psi(Line2D): reference to the line on which the psi state is plot handle_v(Line2D): reference to the line on which the v state is plot handle_w(Line2D): reference to the line on which the w state is plot

plot(data: Data[UnicycleStateType]) → None¶

Plots the line trajectory

py_sim.plotting.plotting.create_oriented_polygon(pose: UnicyleStateProtocol, rad: float) → tuple[list[float], list[float]]¶

create_oriented_polygon: Returns the oriented polygon to represent a given pose

Parameters:

  • pose – The position and orientation of the vehicle

  • rad – The radius of the vehicle

Returns:

x: The x-coordinate vector

y: The y-coordinate vector

Return type:

tuple[list[float], list[float]]

py_sim.plotting.plotting.init_oriented_position_plot(ax: ~matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes, params: ~py_sim.plotting.plotting.OrientedPositionParams, pose: ~py_sim.tools.sim_types.UnicyleStateProtocol = <py_sim.tools.sim_types.UnicycleState object>) → Polygon¶

init_oriented_position_plot Creates a triangle-like shape to show the orientaiton of the vehicle

Parameters:

  • ax – The axis on which to create the plot

  • params – The parameters defining the plot

  • pose – The position and orientation of the vehicle

Returns:

Polygon reference for later updating

Return type:

Polygon

py_sim.plotting.plotting.initialize_2d_line_plot(ax: Axes, x: float, y: float, color: tuple[float, float, float, float], style: str = '-', label: str = '') → Line2D¶

Initializes a two-dimensional line plot

Parameters:

  • ax – The axis on which to create the plot

  • x – initial x-position

  • y – initial y-position

  • color – The color to plot (rgb-alpha, i.e., color and transparency)

  • style – The line style of the plot

  • label – The label to assign to the trajectory plot

Returns:

Reference to the plot (Line2D) for later modification

Return type:

Line2D

py_sim.plotting.plotting.initialize_position_plot(ax: ~matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes, color: tuple[float, float, float, float], label: str = '', location: ~py_sim.tools.sim_types.TwoDArrayType = <py_sim.tools.sim_types.TwoDimArray object>) → Line2D¶

initialize_position_plot Initializes the plotting of a position and returns a reference to the position plot

Args:

ax: The axis on which to create the plot color: The color to plot (rgb-alpha, i.e., color and transparency) label: The label to assign to the position location: The oiriginal location of the position

Returns:

Line2D: Reference to the plot (Line2D) for later modification

py_sim.plotting.plotting.plot_occupancy_grid_cells(ax: Axes, grid: BinaryOccupancyGrid, color_occupied: tuple[float, float, float, float] = (0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.5), color_free: tuple[float, float, float, float] = (1.0, 1.0, 1.0, 0.5)) → list[matplotlib.patches.Polygon]¶

Plots the occupancy grid as circles

Parameters:

  • ax – axis on which the grid should be plotted

  • grid – grid to be plotted

  • color_occupied – color of the occupied regions

  • color_free – color of the free regions.

Returns:

plot handles for occupied and free plots, each one being a cell

Return type:

list[Polygon]

py_sim.plotting.plotting.plot_occupancy_grid_circles(ax: Axes, grid: BinaryOccupancyGrid, color_occupied: tuple[float, float, float, float] = (0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.5), color_free: tuple[float, float, float, float] | None = None) → tuple[matplotlib.lines.Line2D, Optional[matplotlib.lines.Line2D]]¶

Plots the occupancy grid as circles

Parameters:

  • ax – axis on which the grid should be plotted

  • grid – grid to be plotted

  • color_occupied – color of the occupied regions

  • color_free – color of the free regions. If not provided then the free regions are not plotted

Returns:

plot handles for occupied and free plots

Return type:

tuple[Line2D, Optional[Line2D]]

py_sim.plotting.plotting.plot_occupancy_grid_image(ax: Axes, grid: BinaryOccupancyGrid) → AxesImage¶
Plots the occupancy grid as an image as well as the grid lines. This is much faster

then plotting the grid cells individually, especially for large occupancy grids.

Parameters:

  • ax – axis on which the grid should be plotted

  • grid – grid to be plotted

Returns:

The handle for the image used to plot the occupancy map

Return type:

AxesImage

py_sim.plotting.plotting.plot_polygon_world(ax: Axes, world: PolygonWorld, color: tuple[float, float, float, float] = (1.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.9)) → list[matplotlib.patches.Polygon]¶

Plots each of the polygons in the world

Parameters:

  • ax – axis on which the world should be plotted

  • world – the instance of the world to be plotted

  • color – the color of the obstacles

Returns:

A list of all of the polygon plot objects

Return type:

list[Polygon]

py_sim.plotting.plotting.plot_visited(ax: Axes, planner: GridVisitedType) → AxesImage¶
Plots the occupancy grid as an image as well as the grid lines. This is much faster

then plotting the grid cells individually, especially for large occupancy grids.

Parameters:

  • ax – axis on which the grid should be plotted

  • grid – grid to be plotted

Returns:

The handle for the image used to plot the occupancy map

Return type:

AxesImage

py_sim.plotting.plotting.update_2d_line_plot(line: Line2D, x_vec: ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]], y_vec: ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]]) → None¶

update_traj_plot: Updates the trajectory with the latest location

Parameters:

  • line – Reference to the line to be updated

  • x_vec – The data for the x coordinate

  • y_vec – The data for the y coordinate

py_sim.plotting.plotting.update_oriented_position_plot(plot: Polygon, params: OrientedPositionParams, pose: UnicyleStateProtocol) → None¶

update_oriented_position_plot: Updates the plot for the orientated position

Parameters:

  • ax – The axis on which to create the plot

  • params – The parameters defining the plot

  • pose – The position and orientation of the vehicle

py_sim.plotting.plotting.update_position_plot(line: Line2D, location: TwoDArrayType) → None¶

update_position_plot: Updates the position of a previously drawn circle

Parameters:

  • line – Reference to the line to be updated

  • location – The (x,y) position of the new location

py_sim.plotting.plotting.update_traj_plot(line: Line2D, location: TwoDArrayType) → None¶

update_traj_plot: Updates the trajectory with the latest location

Parameters:

  • line – Reference to the line to be updated

  • location – The (x,y) position of the new location
